layout.wait_new_version_startup: Waiting for the new version to start...

error.you_can_find_your_way_back: You can find your way back
error.you_are_lost: Ooops you are lost! But don't be afraid!

forms.name: Name
forms.public_port_range_explainer:
Ports used to expose databases/services/internal services.
Add them to your firewall (if applicable).

You can specify a range of ports, eg: 9000-9100

register.first_user: You are registering the first user. It will be the administrator of your Coolify instance.

configuration.branch_already_in_use: This branch is already used by another application. Webhooks won't work in this case for both applications. Are you sure you want to use it?
configuration.no_repositories_configured: No repositories configured for your Git Application.
configuration.scanning_repository_suggest_build_pack: Scanning repository to suggest a build pack for you...
configuration.found_lock_file:
Found lock file for {{packageManager}}.
Using it for predefined commands commands.

preview.setup_secret_app_first:
You can add secrets to PR/MR deployments. Please add secrets to the application first.
Useful for creating staging environments.
preview.values_overwriting_app_secrets: These values overwrite application secrets in PR/MR deployments. Useful for creating staging environments.

storage.persistent_storage_explainer:
You can specify any folder that you want to be persistent across deployments.

/example means it will preserve /example between deployments.

Your application's data is copied to /app inside the container, you can preserve data under it as well, like /app/db.

This is useful for storing data such as a database (SQLite) or a cache.

application.confirm_to_delete: Are you sure you would like to delete '{{name}}'?
application.permission_denied_stop_application: You do not have permission to stop the application.
application.permission_denied_rebuild_application: You do not have permission to rebuild application.
application.permission_denied_build_and_start_applic: You do not have permission to deploy application.
application.permission_denied_delete_application: You do not have permission to delete this application
application.dns_not_set_error:
DNS not set correctly or propogated for {{domain}}.

Please check your DNS settings.
application.domain_not_valid:
Could not resolve domain or it's not pointing to the server IP address.

Please check your DNS configuration and try again.
application.base_image_explainer: Image that will be used for the deployment.
application.base_build_image_explainer: Image that will be used during the build process.
application.https_explainer:
If you specify https, the application will be accessible only over https. SSL certificate will be generated for you.
If you specify www, the application will be redirected (302) from non-www and vice versa.

To modify the domain, you must first stop the application.

You must set your DNS to point to the server IP in advance.
application.ssl_www_and_non_www: Generate SSL for www and non-www?
application.ssl_explainer:
It will generate certificates for both www and non-www.
You need to have both DNS entries set in advance.

Useful if you expect to have visitors on both.
application.directory_to_use_explainer:
Directory to use as the base for all commands.
Could be useful with monorepos.
application.publish_directory_explainer:
Directory containing all the assets for deployment.
For example: dist,_site or public.
application.enable_preview_deploy_mr_pr_requests: Enable preview deployments from pull or merge requests.
application.enable_debug_log_during_build:
Enable debug logs during build phase.
Sensitive information could be visible and saved in logs.
application.cant_activate_auto_deploy_without_repo: Cannot activate automatic deployments until only one application is defined for this repository / branch.

database.generated_automatically_after_set_to_pub: Generated automatically after set to public
database.warning_database_public:
Your database will be reachable over the internet.
Take security seriously in this case!
database.warning_append_only:
Useful if you would like to restore redis data from a backup.
Database restart is required.
database.confirm_stop: Are you sure you would like to stop {{name}}?
database.permission_denied_stop_database: You do not have permission to stop the database.
database.permission_denied_start_database: You do not have permission to start the database.
database.permission_denied_delete_database: You do not have permission to delete a Database

destination.permission_denied_delete_destination: You do not have permission to delete this destination
destination.confirm_restart_proxy: Are you sure you want to restart the proxy? Everything will be reconfigured in ~10 secs.
destination.new_error_network_already_exists: Network {{network}} already configured for another team!

new.install_proxy:
This will install a proxy on the destination to allow you to access your applications and services without any manual configuration (recommended for Docker).

Databases will have their own proxy.

sources.organization_explainer: Fill it if you would like to use an organization's as your Git Source. Otherwise your user will be used.

source.permission_denied: You do not have permission to delete a Git Source
source.oauth_id_explainer:
The OAuth ID is the unique identifier of the GitLab application.
You can find it in the URL of your GitLab OAuth Application.
source.register_oauth_gitlab: Register new OAuth application on GitLab

services.all_email_verified: All emails are verified. You can login now.
services.generate_www_non_www_ssl:
It will generate certificates for both www and non-www.
You need to have both DNS entries set in advance.

Service needs to be restarted.

service.permission_denied_stop_service: You do not have permission to stop the service.
service.permission_denied_start_service: You do not have permission to start the service.
service.permission_denied_delete_service: You do not have permission to delete a service.

setting.permission_denied: You do not have permission to do this. \nAsk an admin to modify your permissions.
setting.ssl_explainer:
If you specify https, Coolify will be accessible only over https. SSL certificate will be generated for you.
If you specify www, Coolify will be redirected (302) from non-www and vice versa.

WARNING: If you change an already set domain, it will break webhooks and other integrations! You need to manually update them.
setting.must_remove_domain_before_changing: Must remove the domain before you can change this setting.
setting.registration_allowed_explainer:
Allow further registrations to the application.
It's turned off after the first registration.
setting.credential_stat_explainer: Credentials for stats page.
setting.auto_update_enabled_explainer: Enable automatic updates for Coolify. It will be done automatically behind the scenes, if there is no build process running.
setting.generate_www_non_www_ssl:
It will generate certificates for both www and non-www.
You need to have both DNS entries set in advance.
setting.is_dns_check_enabled_explainer:
You can disable DNS check before creating SSL certificates.

Turning it off is useful when Coolify is behind a reverse proxy or tunnel.

team.invited_with_permissions: Invited to {{teamName}} with {{permission}} permission.
team.root_team_explainer: This is the root team. That means members of this group can manage instance wide settings and have all the priviliges in Coolify (imagine like root user on Linux).
team.invite_only_register_explainer: You can only invite registered users.
